member.name: P:AddressesJazz.AddressesJazzSettings.Default
member.summary: Gets the default settings instance.

remarks.para: On first access, an attempt is made to load the settings from an application-specific location. If the file is not found or corrupt, then all fields of the returned instance are set to their default values.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.CheckData.CheckNames(System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Check names.
Both first name and family name are not allowed to be empty.
member.param: First name (input string must be trimmed)
Family name (input string must be trimmed)

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.CheckData.CheckEmailAddress(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Check the Email address
There must be an @ in the E-Mail address.
member.param: Email address (input string must be trimmed)

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.CheckData.EmailAddressExists(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Check that the Email address exists
(For the case that a Newsletter is requested).
member.param: Email address (input string must be trimmed)

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.CheckData.CheckMailAddress(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Check the Mail address data
All address fields must be defined
member.param: Street number (input string must be trimmed)
Postal code (input string must be trimmed)

member.name: T:AddressesJazz.ConvertCsv
member.summary:
Class with functions to convert csv files by removing, adding and modifying columns.
These functions were only used once for converting data
The class is kept since the functions are good sample code for Table functions

member.summary: Convert format from C++ application to the C# application. This is a function that only is used one time. Everything is hardcoded.

member.name: T:AddressesJazz.JazzForm
member.summary:
Main form for the JAZZ live AARAU address database
This is the Graphical User Interface to the application. Commands should not be executed in this class.

member.name: F:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_main
member.summary: Main class that executes most of the commands in this application

member.name: F:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_table_addresses
member.summary: Table that holds all addresses

member.name: F:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_row_index
member.summary: Index for the current record

member.name: F:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_search_record_indices
member.summary: Search result record indices

member.name: F:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_search_display_strings
member.summary: Search result record display strings

member.name: F:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_current_version
member.summary: Current version as string

member.name: F:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_is_initializing
member.summary: Flag telling if controls are being initialized

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructor that initializes the form
1. Instance of JazzMain is created.
2. Captions are set (call of _SetCaptions).
3. Seasons controls are set (call of _SetSeasons).
4. Combo Box for output files are set (call of _SetComboboxOutput).
5. Gets the current address list from the server (calls JazzMainDownloadFile)
6. Address Table is created. Call of JazzMain.CreateAddressesTable
7. Text controls are set for the first record in the Table (call of SetControlsTexts).
8. Search controls are initialized (call of _SetSearchResult).
9. Status message (addresses downloaded) is set. Caption Checkout is set.
10. Tool tips are set (call of _SetToolTips)
11. Most controls are disabled since addresses not are checked out (call of _DisableControls).

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.SetTable(ExcelUtil.Table)
member.summary:
Set new table (created by a backup file)
Set input Table instance equal to m_table_addresses
TODO Delete no longer used instance

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm._VersionCheck
member.summary:
Checks if there is a new version available
Message will be written to the message control if available.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm._SetToolTips
member.summary:
Set tool tips
Note that there also are tool tips for Labels since disabled controls don't show tool tips

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.SetControlsTexts(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set texts for all controls
Function GetFieldString in class Table is called for each field.
Set default values for post (mail), newsletter and sponsor iv values not are set, i.e. for a new record
Text field for the current season is set (call of _SetTextBoxSupport)
member.param: Index for the row (record) that shall be displayed

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm._SetTextBoxSupport(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set text box support for the selected season

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm._SetSeasons
member.summary:
Set combobox seasons
Function GetAllSeasons in class Season is called.

member.summary: Set combobox output

Check table record

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm._SetTableRecord(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set table record, i.e. write the data to Table m_table_addresses
(Changes that the user may have done are saved).
Function SetFieldString in class Table is called for each field.
Note that when there is no support the displayed field is empty, but in the Table it must be set to 0.

Enable controls (when addresses are checked out)
Color for the (Checkout)/Save button is set to OrangeRed.

member.summary:
Mouse wheel was rotated
Current (displayed) record must be checked before setting (saving) it. (call of _CheckTableRecord)
Set record (call of _SetTableRecord)
Convert rotation to new current record index in Table
Display current record in the Table (call of SetControlsTexts)

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_button_previous_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)

Display previous row (record)

Set record (call of _SetTableRecord)
Change current index to previos index
Display current record in the Table (call of SetControlsTexts)

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_button_next_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
Display next row (record)

Set record (call of _SetTableRecord)

Display current record in the Table (call of SetControlsTexts)

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_button_delete_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
Delete a record
Call of function JazzMain.RemoveRow
Display first record in the Table (call of SetControlsTexts).

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_button_add_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
Add an address record
Current (displayed) record must be checked before setting (saving) it. (call of _CheckTableRecord)
Set record (call of _SetTableRecord)
Call of JazzMain.AppendEmptyRow that adds a record. Record index is returned
Set support to 0 for all seasons (call of JazzMain.SetSupportToZeroForRow)
Display new record in the Table (call of SetControlsTexts)

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_button_exit_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
Exit application.
1. Handle the case when addresses are checked out. Call of _ExitWhenAddressesAreCheckedOut.
2. Remove all temporary used files. Call of JazzMain.RemoveAllTemporaryUsedFiles.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.JazzForm_FormClosing(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.FormClosingEventArgs)
member.summary:
Main form is closing when the user has killed the main form with the Cancel button.
Handles the case when addresses are checked out. Addresses (changes) will not be saved.
1. If addresses are are checked out call of JazzMain.UploadCheckOutInFileButNotAddresses.
2. Delete all temporary used files. Call of JazzMain.RemoveAllTemporaryUsedFiles

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm._ExitWhenAddressesAreCheckedOut
member.summary: Handles the case when the user exits the application and the addresses are checked out

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm._CheckInAddresses
member.summary:
Check in the CSV file with addresses
Call of JazzMain.CreateAndUploadFiles
Change button Save to caption Checkout
Set status message
Disable controls (call of _DisableControls).

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm._CheckOutAddresses
member.summary:
Check out file with addresses
1. Update the table with current address data from the server. Call of _UpdateTableWithAddressesFromServer.
2. Checkout. Call of JazzMain.CheckOutAddresses
Show error message if addresses are checked out by somebody else
For this case give the user the possibility to anyhow checkout addresses
If the user wants this call JazzMain.ForceCheckOutAddresses
3. Change button caption from Checkout to Save
4. Display status message
5. Enable the controls. Call of _EnableControls.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm._UpdateTableWithAddressesFromServer(System.String@)
member.summary:
Update table with addresses data from the server
This function should be called just before a checkout is made. Other persons may have changed data.
1. Function shall only be called when addresses not are checked out. Call of JazzMain.AddressesCheckedOut.
2. Get names for current record. Calls of Table.GetFieldString
3. Download the csv address file from the server. Call of JazzMain.DownloadFile.
4. Create the table with the downloaded file. Call of JazzMain.CreateAddressesTable.
5. Set the current record to one (1) if names not are equal, i.e. somebody else has added rows.
6. Set the controls for the current record. Call of SetControlsTexts.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzForm.m_button_checkinout_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Checkin or checkout file with addresses

member.name: T:AddressesJazz.JazzMain
member.summary:
Main class for the application Jazz Adressen. that executes most of the commands in this application
This class executes most of the commands coming from the controls of the JazzForm form.
The other command execution classes are Output and Reset. In the GUI JazzForm class should nothing be executed.
Typical commands are: Add or delete a person in the address database, sort records, output lists, etc.
At start of the application the current address list (a CSV file) will be downloaded with FTP.
The downloaded address list defines an instance of the class Table that holds all data of the list.
Changes of the address list can only be done if the address list has been checked out.
Checkout means that the user will be registered in an checkin/checkout file also down- and uploaded with FTP
Only one person at a time can checkout the address list.

member.name: F:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.m_ftp_password
member.summary: FTP password for the download and upload

member.summary: Get FTP password

member.summary: Addresses table. The table corresponds to the input/otput CSV file.

member.summary: The main form for this application. Commands are coming from controls (edit fields, buttons, ..) of this form.

member.summary: Encoding used for read and write for files

member.summary: Get or set the flag telling if the addresses list has been checked out

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.#ctor(AddressesJazz.JazzForm)
member.summary:
Constructor
The config file will be created by a function in class AddressesJazzSettings if not existing in the exe directory.
After the installation of a new version of the application Jazz Adressen the file should (must) be created.
member.param: The main form for application Jazz Adressen

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.CreateAndUploadFiles(System.String@)
member.summary:
Create and upload the address CSV file
Upload of the address file is only allowed if addresses has been checked out.
1. The function checks if there is an Internet connection.
2. The checkin/checkout log file is downloaded with FTP. Return with error message if not checked out.
3. The address CSV file and a backup copy is created by the function TableToCsv in class FromTable.
4. The CSV files are uploaded by the function UploadFile in the class Ftp.UpLoad.
5. A checkin line is added in the checkin/checkout log file. This file is also upoaded with UploadFile.
6. The flag m_addresses_checked_out is set to false.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.CreateAndUploadSupporterXmlFile(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String@)
member.summary: Creates and uploads a supporter XML file to the server
member.returns: True if the XML file was uploaded

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.UploadCheckOutInFileButNotAddresses(System.String@)
member.summary:
Check in without saving addresses
Function for the case that addresses are checked out but the user don't want to upload (save) the file.
The checkin/checkout log file is downloaded with FTP and a checkin line is appended.
The checkin/checkout log file is upoaded with UploadFile in class Ftp.UpLoad.
The flag m_addresses_checked_out is set to false.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.DownloadFile(System.String@)
member.summary:
Download the addresses CSV file from the server with FTP
1. The function checks if there is an Internet connection.
2. The addresses CSV file is downloaded with function DownloadFile in class Ftp.DownLoad.
3. The file is saved in a subdirectory (Excel) to the exe directory.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.DownloadNewVersion(System.String@)
member.summary:
Download an installer for a new version of the Jazz Adressen application from the server with FTP
1. The function checks if there is an Internet connection.
2. The installer is (and possibly other files are) downloaded with function Getfiles in class Ftp.DownLoad.
3. The installer is saved in a subdirectory (NeueVersion) to the exe directory.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.GetSaveAddressesMessage(System.String@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Get the error message when the user has checked out addresses and exits the application with cancel.
member.para: 1. Message and caption is retrieved from the configuration file (AddressesJazzSettings).

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.CheckOutAddresses(System.String@)
member.summary:
Check out the addresses file
1. The checkin/checkout file is downloaded (with function _DownloadCheckOutInLogFile).
2. The fields of the last row in the file is retrieved (with function _GetLastRowCheckInOutFields)
3. Return with error if addresses already are checked out by somebody else.
4. Append logout line with function _AppendLogFileRow
5. Upload the checkin/checkout file with function UploadFile in class Ftp.UpLoad.
6. The flag m_addresses_checked_out is set to true.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.ForceCheckOutAddresses(System.String@)
member.summary:
Force a checkout even if addresses are checked out by somebody else,
i.e. check out the addresses file without checking if is checked in
There should normally be no need to call this function! End of application shall always make a checkin.
1. The checkin/checkout file is downloaded (with function _DownloadCheckOutInLogFile).
2. Append logout line with function _AppendLogFileRow
3. Upload the checkin/checkout file with function UploadFile in class Ftp.UpLoad.
4. The flag m_addresses_checked_out is set to true.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain._AddressesAreCheckedOut(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Returns false if addresses not are checked out by this computer
1. The fields of the last row in the file is retrieved (with function _GetLastRowCheckInOutFields)
2. Return with error if computer field name not is equal to this computer.
member.param: Full local name of the checkin-checkout file

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain._DownloadCheckOutInLogFile(System.String@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary:
Download the checkin/checkout file from the server with FTP
1. The function checks if there is an Internet connection.
2. The checkin/checkout file is downloaded with function DownloadFile in class Ftp.DownLoad.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain._AppendLogFileRow(System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Append row to login-logout file
Time and machine (computer) is added to the input string.
The line is appended to the file.
member.param: Start string for the append row (login or logout)

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain._GetLastRowCheckInOutFields(System.String,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary:
Get the fields of the last row of the checkin-checkout file
1. Get last row (call of function _GetLastRow).
2. Retrieve the field values. The start of each row is defined by configuration
file strings CheckInLogFile and CheckOutLogFile
member.param: Machine name field of the row

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain._GetLastRow(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Get last row of the input file
member.para: File is opened and all rows are read. The last (not empy) row is returned.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.CreateAddressesTable(System.String@)
member.summary:
Create addresses table from the addresses list
1. Create and set the row header. Call of _SetRowHeader.
2. An instance of class Table is created (member variable m_table_addresses)
3. Get the local name of the csv file. Call of _GetAddressesFileName.
4. Create the table from the (from the server downloaded) csv file. Call of ToTable.CsvToTable.
5. For a new current season add a supporter column. Call of _AddSupporterColumnForNewCurrentSeason
6. Set header for the table (although not yet used in the application). Call of Table.SetRowHeader.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain._AddSupporterColumnForNewCurrentSeason(ExcelUtil.RowHeader,System.String@)
member.summary:
For a new current season a supporter column will be added
The table m_table_addresses is the input and output table.
The input header row determines if a supporter column shall be added
1. Return without doing anything if the number of columns of the header row and the table is equal.
2. Get the field header name from the input header row. Call of FileHeader.GetFieldHeader.Name
3. Create string array with values for the column that shall be appended. Call of _SupportColumnInitialValuesAsStrings.
4. Create the column to append. Call of ExcelUtil.TableTools.CreateColumn.
5. Append the column. Call of ExcelUtil.TableTools.InsertColumn.
6. Create the csv file with the added column. Call of FromTable.TableToCsv
It is important that this file is created. Functions may create table from the file.
Please note that the csv file with the appended column will be saved on the server with checkout->checkin (and not by this function).

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain._SupportColumnInitialValuesAsStrings(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Create array of default values for a support column
The first element of the array (column) will get the value i_field_header.
All the other values of the output array (the column) will be '0'
member.param: Number of rows of the table

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.GetTable
member.summary: Returns the table (m_table_addresses) with addresses

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain._StringToEnum(System.String)
member.summary: Convert field type string to field type enum

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain._SetRowHeader(ExcelUtil.RowHeader@)
member.summary:
Create and set row header for the address table
The data for the first eleven (11) header records are retrieved from the config XML file object (AddressesJazzSettings)
The next header records are supporter records. Such a record holds the amount of money that a person has paid in order to become a supporter.
There is one record for each season starting with 2009-2010. The last header record is for the current season.
Please note that the existing csv file may not have records (a column) corresponding to the last supporter header record.
This occurs when a new season becomes the current season. Function Season.GetCurrentSeasonStartYear defines the current season.
Data for the supporter header records are retrieved with Season functions RecordNameSupporter, RecordTypeSupporter and RecordHelpSupporter.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.ReplaceAddressesTable(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Replace the existing addresses table with a new table defined by an input (backup) file
For the case that the address CSV file is corrupted a backup file can be used.
1. Create an instance of Table
2. Set (backup) data with function CsvToTable in class ToTable
3. Set m_table_addresses to the new Table instance
member.param: Input CSV file with full path

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.Search(System.String,System.String[]@,System.Int32[]@,System.String@)
member.summary:
Returns a string array with found records and a corresponding array with record indices
The function GetRows in class TableSearch is used to get the records with the given search string.
Search is made in fields first name and family name.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.Sort(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Sorts the table
1. Function SortField in class TableSort is called.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.AppendEmptyRow(System.Int32@,System.String@)
member.summary: Append empty row to the table

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.SetSupportToZeroForRow(System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary:
Set support for all seasons to zero (0) in a given row
The support is not allowed to be empty
1. Functions Table.GetRow, Table.GetField, Field.FieldValue and Row.SetFieldValue are called.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.RemoveRow(System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary:
Remove row in the table
1. Function Table.RemoveRow is called.
member.param: Index for that shall be removed

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.RemoveAllTemporaryUsedFiles(System.String@)
member.summary:
Remove all temporary used files
1. Delete backup files. Call of RemoveTemporaryUsedBackupFiles. Installer should create subdirectories Excel and Backups with modify rights

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.RemoveTemporaryUsedBackupFiles(System.String@)
member.summary:
Remove temporary used backup files
1. Get backup file names. Call of Reset.GetBackupFiles.
2. Delete backup files.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.JazzMain.RemoveTemporaryUsedCheckinCheckoutFile(System.String@)
member.summary:
Remove temporary used checkin-checkout file
1. Get checkin-checkout file name. Call of _GetCheckInOutLogFileName.
2. Delete checkin-checkout file.

member.name: T:AddressesJazz.Output
member.summary:
Class that handles output of lists
Output is for instance Excel files and text files with names and addresses for the yearly letter and for the supporters.
The requests are commands (calls) normally coming from the JazzForm class.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.GetAllOutput
member.summary:
Get all available output lists as an array of strings.
The function should be called from a Form class for e.g. a Combo Box.
The returned (hardcoded) array defines the available output lists.
The first element in the array is a header (caption) for the elements
All array names are defined in the configuration file (class AddressesJazzSettings).

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.GetHeaderItem
member.summary: Get the header (prompt/caption),i.e. the first item in the array of output lists.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.ExecuteRequest(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Output the requested list
One of the following execution functions are called
- MailAdressesAsXslx
- MailAdressesAsCsv
- SupportListTxt
- SponsorListTxt
- SupportAddressesAsCsv
member.param: Text corresponding to the selected index

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.MailAdressesAsXslx(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Output mail addresses as XLSX file
A Table with mail addresses for the XLSX output is created with condition Post=WAHR and Sponsor=FALSCH.
Function TableToXlsx in class FromTable is called.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.MailAdressesAsCsv(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Output mail addresses as CSV file
A Table with mail addresses for the CSV output is created with condition Post=WAHR and Sponsor=FALSCH.
Function TableToCsv in class FromTable is called.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.MailAddressesModify(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String@)
member.summary:
Modify output mail addresses
Only the address data (columns) that will be used for a mail will be kept
member.param: Table with addresses that will be modified (input and output)

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.SupportListTxt(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Output of list as text file with supporters for a given season
The fields (columns) that shall be outputted is defined in a hardcoded string array.
Sizes of the output text fields and if the text shall be right or left aligned are also defined.
Output records (supporters) are defined by the support sum (> 0 CHF) for the input season.
The text file should be created in subdirectory (Output) in the exe directory.
Supporter) data is written to the file.
The output text file is opened with Notepad.
member.param: The season that user has set
Output file name with full path

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.SupportersAsXml(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Output a list as XML file with supporters
member.param: The season that user has set
Output file name with full path

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.SupportAddressesAsCsv(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Output a list as CSV Excel file with supporter addresses
member.param: The season that user has set
Output file name with full path

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output._OutputWarningFile(System.String[],System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Creates a file with warnings and opens it with notepad

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.SponsorListTxt(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Output list of sponsors as text file
The fields (columns) that shall be outputted is defined in a hardcoded string array.
Sizes of the output text fields and if the text shall be right or left aligned are also defined.
Output records (sponsors) are defined by the flag Sponsor=WAHR.
The text file should be created in subdirectory (Output) in the exe directory.
Sponsor data is written to the file. Function _OutputSupportListRow constructs the output line.
The output text file is opened with Notepad.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.NewsletterListTxt(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Outputs a list of newsletter addressees as a text file
The fields (columns) that shall be outputted is defined in a hardcoded string array.
Sizes of the output text fields and if the text shall be right or left aligned are also defined.
Output records are defined by the flag NewsletterJazz=WAHR.
The text file should be created in subdirectory (Output) in the exe directory.
Function _OutputSupportListRow constructs the output line.
The output text file is opened with Notepad.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.CheckListTxt(ExcelUtil.Table,System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Output list of check results as a text file
The fields (columns) that shall be outputted is defined in a hardcoded string array.
Sizes of the output text fields and if the text shall be right or left aligned are also defined.
Output records are defined by the flags Post=FALSCH, NewsletterJazz=FALSCH and Sponsor=FALSCH.
The text file should be created in subdirectory (Output) in the exe directory.
Sponsor data is written to the file. Function _OutputSupportListRow constructs the output line.
The output text file is opened with Notepad.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output._OutputSupportListRow(System.String[],System.Int32[],System.Boolean[])
member.summary:
Returns one row for an output list
Column values (text fields) that are too long will be shortened
member.param: Array with flags defining how the text shall be aligned

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.StartExcel(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Starts Excel
member.param: Output file name with full path

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Output.FileIsLocked(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if file is locked

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Program.Main
member.summary: The main entry point for the application.

member.name: T:AddressesJazz.Reset
member.summary: Class with functions that handle reset to an older (backup) address list

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Reset.DownloadBackupFiles(System.String@)
member.summary:
Download backup files from the server.
1. Host and user name from the configuration file (). Password () from JazzMain.m_ftp_password.
2. The function checks if there is an Internet connection.
3. The backup addresses CSV files are downloaded with function GetFiles in class Ftp.DownLoad.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Reset.GetBackupFiles(System.String[]@,System.String@)
member.summary:
Get available backup files as an array of strings.
Downloaded backup files are on a subdirectory (Backup) to the exe directory
1. Function GetFilesDirectory in class FileUtil is called to get the file names.

member.name: M:AddressesJazz.Reset.ResetWithBackupFile(AddressesJazz.JazzMain,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Reset the addresses Table with a Table defined by a backup file.
1. Function JazzMain.ReplaceAddressesTable executes the command
member.param: Full name of the backup file

member.name: P:AddressesJazz.Properties.Resources.TestProtokoll
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Test von JazzAdressen =====================
Bitte diese Datei als TestProtokoll_yyyymmdd.txt speichern.
Kurzname fr JAZZ live Aarau Adressen 2014 Beta Version ist unten "Beta".
Name des Testers: Betriebssystem des Computers: Datum:
Herunterladen von Beta mit Download
Deinstallieren von der vorigen Beta
Installieren von Beta
Nach einige Personen suchen
Die Daten fr einige Personen ndern. Teste auch nicht erlaubte nderungen wie alles leer, ungltige E-Mailadressen, etc. Be [rest of string was truncated]";.
